Title: üáªüá™ -I will be in Venezuela-: Edmundo Gonz√°lez reaffirms that he...
Description: üáªüá™ -I will be in Venezuela-: Edmundo Gonz√°lez reaffirms that he will take office in Caracas and announces that Mar√≠a Corina will be his vice presidentEdmundo Gonz√°lez Urrutia is firm. On January 10th he will be in Caracas taking office as the first president. -That is clear: I will be in Venezuela- on that date, the president-elect told the Spanish newspaper El Pa√≠s. His answer to whether he would preside over a government in exile was clear: -No.-Speaking to SEMANA, Gonz√°lez had made it clear that he would be in his country on that date and for that purpose. -Yes, my aspiration is to do it in Venezuela. That is the intention we have and in this way we aspire to fulfill the mandate of the popular will that was expressed on July 28 by more than 7 million voters,- he said.Regarding the catastrophic situation in which Venezuela would be received on January 10, Gonz√°lez said: -We have a fairly broad government plan, whose guidelines are contained in a text that has been studied, analyzed and reviewed by the best technicians we have. We also have a government plan for the first 100 days. We have priority areas, which in the country are almost all, and which require immediate attention in all sectors. We must recover the economy, the social fabric of the country, the relations with neighboring countries. We are going to form a government team that can implement all the adjustments that are necessary for the recovery of the country. Recovery in the broadest sense: democratic, social, economic.-

Title: Saab says they are still reviewing cases of those arrested in pos...
Description: Saab says they are still reviewing cases of those arrested in post-election protestsAttorney General Tarek William Saab confirmed on Thursday afternoon, December 5, that they will continue to review the measures of deprivation of liberty of those arrested during the post-election protests in July. However, he insisted that the possibility of favorable decisions will depend on each case.Saab, interviewed in La Iguana, mentioned the case of the teenager Mariana G√≥nzalez, who was released from prison and was subject to a review measure after an evaluation made by the Public Prosecutor's Office and the forensic doctor.He stressed that the authorities managed to quell -the violence- in the demonstrations that took place after the elections, following the announcement by the CNE that it had awarded the victory to President Nicol√°s Maduro. In his opinion, this left the opposition -with nothing.-On the night of Wednesday, December 4, Saab himself announced that the teenager Mariana Gonz√°lez - arrested on July 29 during the post-election protests - had been released after requesting a review of the measure.The teenager's case became known a few days ago through a letter sent to her parents. The 16-year-old wrote a letter to her mother in which she revealed the conditions in which she was held and stated that she felt -without strength- and -without the will to live.-In the letter, shared by the human rights account Vente Venezuela, Gonz√°lez said that he missed his mother very much and that he was depressed.

Title: Panamanian government assures that it will not receive migrants d...
Description: Panamanian government assures that it will not receive migrants deported by the US.-In light of international law, we have no obligation to receive deportees of nationalities other than Panamanian. We wish to maintain relations with the United States always within the framework of mutual respect,- the Panamanian Foreign Ministry said on Thursday.The Foreign Ministry's statement comes hours after NBC reported that the future Donald Trump administration would be preparing a list of countries to which it could deport migrants if their countries of origin refused to accept them. According to NBC, that list would include the Turks and Caicos Islands, the Bahamas, Grenada and Panama.The Bahamas government on Thursday rejected US President-elect Donald Trump's proposal to accept migrants from other countries expelled by Washington.

Title: ICC Prosecutor's Office includes in its investigation complaints ...
Description: ICC Prosecutor's Office includes in its investigation complaints for crimes committed after June 28The Prosecutor of the International Criminal Court (ICC) confirmed that it has included in its investigation into Venezuela the complaints received for alleged crimes against humanity committed after the presidential elections of July 28.In his 2024 management report, prosecutor Karim Khan recalled that after the Appeals Chamber rejected the appeal filed by Nicol√°s Maduro's regime on March 1, the Prosecutor's Office -quickly- resumed its investigation.-Following the presidential elections held in Venezuela on 28 July 2024, the Office received several communications concerning alleged crimes against humanity, which were assessed in accordance with the Statute. The Office determined that these communications could fall within the scope of its ongoing investigation and is therefore considering them in this context,- said Prosecutor Khan.

Title: After the ICC's pronouncement, Saab denounces a campaign to white...
Description: After the ICC's pronouncement, Saab denounces a campaign to whitewash -terrorists-Attorney General Tarek William Saab said opposition leaders inside and outside the country have launched a campaign to undermine Venezuela and whitewash alleged terrorist groups that the government says have harmed the nation following the July 28 presidential election.He noted that Venezuela is a testing ground for the use of hybrid war strategies aimed at overthrowing legitimate governments, including violence, sanctions and destabilization. He urged the world to open its eyes to the realities being revealed.

Title: Former presidents ask Lula and the Vatican to intercede for Venez...
Description: Former presidents ask Lula and the Vatican to intercede for Venezuelans in the Argentine embassyA group of 29 former presidents of Latin America and the Spanish government asked the president of Brazil, Luiz In√°cio Lula da Silva, and the Vatican on Monday to intercede on behalf of the six Venezuelans who have been refugees since March in the Argentine Embassy in Caracas -guarded by Brazil-, and who are in -conditions of isolation.-Former heads of state members of the Democratic Initiative of Spain and the Americas (IDEA) pointed out that Venezuelans seeking asylum in the diplomatic headquarters, who are immediate collaborators of opposition leader Mar√≠a Corina Machado, are being subjected to -inhuman and degrading treatment- and are prevented from receiving -vital and medical services.-
